New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first 50/50 player in MLB history with 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases.
Ohtani's 17 total bases and 10 RBIs are the most ever for a leadoff hitter in one game.
Ohtani broke the Dodgers' season home run record previously held by Shawn Green with 49 home runs.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani went 6-for-6 with three home runs, two doubles, 10 RBIs, and two stolen bases in the Dodgers' 20-4 win over the Miami Marlins.
Ohtani was only a few feet away from hitting a fourth home run and completing a cycle during the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts praised Ohtani's performance, stating, 'To do something that’s never been done … he’s one of one.'
Ohtani expressed relief and respect for achieving the 50/50 milestone, saying, 'Just happy, relieved and very respectful to the peers and everybody that came before.'
Former Dodger Shawn Green called Ohtani the 'greatest player who ever lived' and expressed admiration for Ohtani breaking his home run record.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Miami manager Skip Schumaker decided against intentionally walking Ohtani out of respect and belief in baseball karma.
Ohtani's performance made headlines in Tokyo in the Japanese newspaper Sports Hochi.
